A normal sized person doubled in size will generally have strength of 18.

Type: Arcane

School: Transmutation/Alteration

Sphere: MU

Level: 2

Cast Time: 1

Range: 30 ft

Duration: 16 rounds

Save: See below

AOE: 15 ft radius sphere

Components: V

 

[Foundry Note:  This spell has a lot of options, both because it can be used in a variety of ways, and also because tables will vary on their tolerance for greying out the screens of blinded token owners. 

First, be aware that each darkness effect has a corresponding aura built into it.  When the spell is used as an AOE, the aura does nothing beyond ensuring the full radius of the spell is "black".  

When the spell is cast as an attack centered on a specific non-caster token, these auras might transmit mechanical penalties to tokens within the darkness that isn't centered directly upon them.


Where auras transmit mechanical statuses or penalties they only do so to actors using the PC character sheet template.  Auras won't transmit to NPCs.  A couple of other effects can be used simultaneously to inflict penalties when an NPC hireling, monster, etc., is within a darkness radius.

 

When you cast the spell you'll see the following options in the chat box:

 

  • Effect (Darkness-as-AOE)

You'd use this effect if casting darkness "over there", not centered on any particular token, or if an attack saving throw was made causing the darkness to not be centered directly upon the target.  The effect itself only tracks spell duration (or existence, if the spell is Continual). 

In conjunction with casting, the player/GM would drop the darkness spell NPC linked at bottom at the map location in spell range where the darkness was to be centered. The spell NPC creates the visual darkness effect, blacking out a portion of the map/scene. 

Apply NPC effects discussed below if/when an actor is within this fixed point of darkness (perhaps at a chokepoint, etc.)

 

  • Effect (Carried Darkness)

Carried Darkness is used whenever a caster, or more likely a monster, wants to center a mobile darkness effect on themselves.  LIke Darkness-as-AOE, this version's aura conveys nothing to actor tokens, but the NPC effects below can be applied if something finds itself within the darkness the monster carries.

 

  • Effect (Blinded)

This is the first "attack" effect, when the spell is cast upon some particular actor token.  Presuming the saving throw fails, the darkness effect + aura will center upon the target and be mobile with them.  This aura will transmit the blindness mechanical penalties to any other PC tokens incidentally within the darkness effect, but won't grey out the screen of the player(s) affected.  

 

  • Effect (STATUS blind ALT)

This second choice of attack versions combines mechanical penalties with greying out the screen of an unfortunate PC actor's owner, if they fail a saving throw. (The player is effectively blinded along with their characer). Any penalized attack the character might make must be handled manually as targeting another token isn't possible. This version also indirectly measures a GM's sadism level, but is remarkably effective at convincing players to memorize cure blindness spells "just in case".

This version's aura however transmits nothing to other PC or NPC tokens, as "status" effects can't be transmitted by auras.  See "Effect (NPC Status Blind)" below for use in conjunction.

 

  • Effect (NPC Incidental Blind)

As mentioned above, this secondary no-aura effect dumps only the mechanical penalties (but no screen grey-out or darkness) on any actor type. 

If the primary effect used is "Darkness-as-AOE" + a spell NPC, a GM should apply it to any actor of any type when within the darkness radius (if they don't want to use the Status Blind Alt version instead).

If the primary effect used is "Effect (Blinded), then it only needs applied to NPCs within the darkness radius, because in this case the aura is already penalizing PC actors. 

 

  • Effect (NPC Status Blind)

This secondary no-aura effect is used in conjunction with "Darkness-as-AOE" or "Effect (Status Blind ALT)" to deliver mechanical penalties to those incidentally within a darkness (that isn't centered on them), while also greying out the screen of anyone controlling that token.

- Ed.]

 

 

General

This spell creates an area of utter lightlessness.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

If the spell is cast upon a living creature, the creature is entitled to a saving throw (success indicating that the spell affects the area just behind the creature). 

The spell's effect is neutralised by (and neutralises) the counteracting effect of a Light or Continual Light spell.

 

Combat Effects

The magical darkness prevents all natural vision, even infravision.

Anyone fighting in darkness has a penalty of -4 on all saving throws and rolls to hit if sight is its primary sense. 

[Additionally, those attacking someone blinded (who aren't blinded themselves) attack at a +4 bonus. - Ed]

 

Darkness 15 ft rad (Ball), Fixed AOE
actions.name: (54-58) Darkness (AOE, 15 ft Rad) - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions (AOE Cast)

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • Target the actor who'll carry the Darkness 
    • Note that unlike clerical/monster Darkness, infravision does not penetrate any arcane Darkness so penalties apply to those having sight who carry it or are within it
  • Click the  "Carried Darkness - Duration (T)" action to apply it to the target actor

 

IF USING THE SPELL AS A FREE-STANDING SPHERE OF DARKNESS (ALTERNATE INSTRUCTIONS)

 

  • When summoned, add @UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.actor.Actor.yggi12L4PY7tYWC1]{Darkness 15 ft rad (Ball), Fixed AOE} to the scene
  • toggle the Darkness (AOE, 15 ft Rad) token's visibility to "off" 
  • Add it to the combat tracker - this is necessary for the automatic token death to work
  • Apply the  "Darkness-as-AOE - Duration Autokill" action to the Darkness (AOE, 15 ft Rad) token on the map

actions.description:
Type: Arcane

School: Transmutation/Alteration

Sphere: MU

Level: 2

Cast Time: 1

Range: 30 ft

Duration: 16 rounds

Save: See below

AOE: 15 ft radius sphere

Components: V

 

[Foundry Note:  This spell has a lot of options, both because it can be used in a variety of ways, and also because tables will vary on their tolerance for greying out the screens of blinded token owners. 

First, be aware that each darkness effect has a corresponding aura built into it.  When the spell is used as an AOE, the aura does nothing beyond ensuring the full radius of the spell is "black".  

When the spell is cast as an attack centered on a specific non-caster token, these auras might transmit mechanical penalties to tokens within the darkness that isn't centered directly upon them.


Where auras transmit mechanical statuses or penalties they only do so to actors using the PC character sheet template.  Auras won't transmit to NPCs.  A couple of other effects can be used simultaneously to inflict penalties when an NPC hireling, monster, etc., is within a darkness radius.

 

When you cast the spell you'll see the following options in the chat box:

 

  • Effect (Darkness-as-AOE)

You'd use this effect if casting darkness "over there", not centered on any particular token, or if an attack saving throw was made causing the darkness to not be centered directly upon the target.  The effect itself only tracks spell duration (or existence, if the spell is Continual). 

In conjunction with casting, the player/GM would drop the darkness spell NPC linked at bottom at the map location in spell range where the darkness was to be centered. The spell NPC creates the visual darkness effect, blacking out a portion of the map/scene. 

Apply NPC effects discussed below if/when an actor is within this fixed point of darkness (perhaps at a chokepoint, etc.)

 

  • Effect (Carried Darkness)

Carried Darkness is used whenever a caster, or more likely a monster, wants to center a mobile darkness effect on themselves.  LIke Darkness-as-AOE, this version's aura conveys nothing to actor tokens, but the NPC effects below can be applied if something finds itself within the darkness the monster carries.

 

  • Effect (Blinded)

This is the first "attack" effect, when the spell is cast upon some particular actor token.  Presuming the saving throw fails, the darkness effect + aura will center upon the target and be mobile with them.  This aura will transmit the blindness mechanical penalties to any other PC tokens incidentally within the darkness effect, but won't grey out the screen of the player(s) affected.  

 

  • Effect (STATUS blind ALT)

This second choice of attack versions combines mechanical penalties with greying out the screen of an unfortunate PC actor's owner, if they fail a saving throw. (The player is effectively blinded along with their characer). Any penalized attack the character might make must be handled manually as targeting another token isn't possible. This version also indirectly measures a GM's sadism level, but is remarkably effective at convincing players to memorize cure blindness spells "just in case".

This version's aura however transmits nothing to other PC or NPC tokens, as "status" effects can't be transmitted by auras.  See "Effect (NPC Status Blind)" below for use in conjunction.

 

  • Effect (NPC Incidental Blind)

As mentioned above, this secondary no-aura effect dumps only the mechanical penalties (but no screen grey-out or darkness) on any actor type. 

If the primary effect used is "Darkness-as-AOE" + a spell NPC, a GM should apply it to any actor of any type when within the darkness radius (if they don't want to use the Status Blind Alt version instead).

If the primary effect used is "Effect (Blinded), then it only needs applied to NPCs within the darkness radius, because in this case the aura is already penalizing PC actors. 

 

  • Effect (NPC Status Blind)

This secondary no-aura effect is used in conjunction with "Darkness-as-AOE" or "Effect (Status Blind ALT)" to deliver mechanical penalties to those incidentally within a darkness (that isn't centered on them), while also greying out the screen of anyone controlling that token.

- Ed.]

 

 

General

This spell creates an area of utter lightlessness.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

If the spell is cast upon a living creature, the creature is entitled to a saving throw (success indicating that the spell affects the area just behind the creature). 

The spell's effect is neutralised by (and neutralises) the counteracting effect of a Light or Continual Light spell.

 

Combat Effects

The magical darkness prevents all natural vision, even infravision.

Anyone fighting in darkness has a penalty of -4 on all saving throws and rolls to hit if sight is its primary sense. 

[Additionally, those attacking someone blinded (who aren't blinded themselves) attack at a +4 bonus. - Ed]

 

Darkness 15 ft rad (Ball), Fixed AOE
actions.name: (54-58) Darkness (Attack, 15 ft rad) - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Ask your GM which of the two blindess versions they're using in their campaign (see description for differences)
  • Target the (presumably) enemy actor the caster intends to center the spell effect upon
  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (these may already have been done).
  • If the target actor makes their save, the darkness still occurs - it's just not centered upon them; drop a @UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.actor.Actor.yggi12L4PY7tYWC1]{Darkness 15 ft rad (Ball), Fixed AOE} spell actor in their area (which they may move away from)
  • If the target actor fails their save click either the  "Blinded - Duration (T)" action or the "STATUS Blind - Duration (T)" action to apply it to the targeted actor (this moves with the actor for the duration)
    • These effects have an aura which will automatically penalize any actor entering the darkness radius with no further effort required

actions.description:
Type: Arcane

School: Transmutation/Alteration

Sphere: MU

Level: 1

Cast Time: 1

Range: 30 ft

Duration: 6 turns

Save: Negates

AOE: One creature or object

Components: V

[Foundry Note: the first cast (which doesn't force a saving throw) should be used always, so that the scroll incurs a used charge.  The save in the 2nd cast (which doesn't burn charges) can be used if the spell is cast upon a creature. 

For creatures without a book STR score, which is most "monstrous" NPCs, an effect that simply reduces their damage by a set percentage is also provided, if the GM prefers to handle the spell consequences in that fashion.

The spell may reduce STR on full-stat actors, but can't change the weight of inventory.  This tanks movement rate, which may still be plausible given tiny actors wouldn't move very far per round in absolute distances.  But the GM should be aware of this and feel free to referee movement unconstrained by what the potion does to the value on an actor's character sheet.  - Ed.]

 

General

This spell causes a creature or object to shrink in size and weight. The spell reduces:

  • a creature's size and weight by 120%
  • an object's size and weight by 60%

The magic user's power limits the volume of material that he or she can enlarge; the mage can affect no more than:

  • 60 cubic ft per level of living matter
  • 30 cubic ft per level of non-living matter

The reverse of this spell is Enlarge.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

If the spell is cast on an unwilling recipient, a successful saving throw will negate the spell, but willing recipients may choose to forgo the save.

 

Combat Effects

A normal sized person reduced by 100% will generally have strength reduced by 50%.
actions.name: (66-69) Reduce - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done).
  • Target the wand user and click the  "Reduce (MU L5-L9) - Duration (T)" action
    • If the actor is a non-character monster without a STR score (e.g., a MU summons a goblin and then casts Reduce  on it) then use the  "Reduced No STR Score - Duration (T)" action instead

actions.name: (66-69) Reduce - Wand
actions.misc: Scroll Cast No STR Score - Duration (T)

actions.name: (70-79) Fireball - Wand
actions.description:
Type: Arcane

School: Evocation

Sphere: MU

Level: 3

Cast Time: 1

Range: 160 ft

Duration: Instantaneous

Save: Half

AOE: 20 ft radius sphere

Components: V

 

General

With a pointing gesture at the ending of the incantation, the magic user causes a massive explosion of magical fire at the target point.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

Creatures making successful saving throws suffer only half the indicated damage.  If they fail this saving throw their carried items are also at risk as described below.

The flames do not create any significant change in air pressure, but the furnace-like heat causes items in the blast not borne by someone making a personal saving throw, to make item saving throws against magical fire or ignite (or, in the case of metals, melt). 

 

Combat Effects

When the magic user casts the spell, a bead of light streaks from his or her pointed finger to the target area, and if it strikes another object directly in its path the fireball will detonate immediately.

The fireball detonates with a low roar, causing 6d6 damage to all creatures within the area of effect.

The blast fills the entire volume of the spell radius, and if it is cast into an enclosed area smaller than the area of effect the flames will expand from this area until the spell's full volume has been reached.

The volume of a 20 ft radius sphere is approximately 33,500 cubic ft, and there are 1,000 cubic ft in a 10 ft x 10 ft x 10 ft area, so in an area with a 10 ft ceiling the fireball will fill approximately thirty-three 10 ft x 10 ft squares.

Thus, if a fireball explodes in the middle of a corridor 10 ft wide and 10 ft high, the blast will extend a staggering 165 ft in both directions.

It is quite possible, particularly in dungeoneering environments, for the magic user to be caught in the backblast of his or her own Fireball spell.
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • (Optional) use the  castshape action to visualize the area of effect (you can delete AOE templates if the Templates menu is active)
  • Target all actors in the AOE then cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge and trigger a saving throw (this may already have been done)
  • Click the  "Damage (Fireball)" action

actions.name: (80-84) Invisibility - Wand
actions.description:
Type: Arcane

School: Illusion/Phantasm

Sphere: Phantasmal

Level: 2

Cast Time: 1

Range: Touch

Duration: See below

Save: None

AOE: One creature

Components: V

 

General

When the words of this spell are completed, the recipient and all he or she carries fade from sight, becoming invisible.

Saves and Other Impediments

The spell remains in effect until the invisible creature attacks someone, the caster ends the spell, or the magic is dispelled. Note that the spell does not make the recipient any more quiet than normal, nor does it eliminate scents.

The invisible person can see him- or herself, but the caster (unless they are one and the same) cannot.

The spell cannot be cast upon an unwilling subject.

 

Combat Effects

Invisible opponent: An invisible opponent can only be attacked if the general location is known, and the attack is at –4 to hit.  

Even infravision cannot detect an invisible creature.

If an opponent is invisible to the attacker, he or she cannot be attacked from behind (or from the flank).

Note that more powerful monsters (those with sensitive smell or hearing, or more than six hit dice) will frequently be able to detect invisible opponents; the GM should determine the chance of this according to the creature concerned and the situation.

Powerful magical monsters, or those with more than 11 hit dice, will almost always be able to see invisible creatures normally.
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • Target the selected actor (which may be the caster) and click the "Invisible - Indefinite (T)" action
    • If the invisible actor makes an attack the invisibility is immediately deleted by the GM

actions.name: (91-95) Shimmering Colours - Wand
actions.description:
Type: Arcane

School: Illusion

Sphere: Phantasmal

Level: 2

Cast Time: 1

Range: Caster

Duration: Instantaneous

Save: Negates

AOE: 40 ft x 30 ft

Components: V

 

General

This spell causes the subject to become blind, but causes no damage to the eyes themselves.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

A successful saving throw negates the spell.

The spell may be dispelled normally. It otherwise ends after 1d6 rounds.

 

Combat Effects

The effect cannot be removed by any spell that restores physical health (such as a Healing spell, Cure Disease, etc).
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • (Optional) use the  castshape action to visualize the area of effect (you can delete AOE templates if the Templates menu is active)
  • Target everyone in the AOE then cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done) and trigger a saving throw
  • If the save fails, click on the Blindness action

actions.name: (98-00) Flesh to Stone - Wand
actions.description:
Type: Arcane

School: Transmutation/Alteration

Sphere: MU

Level: 6

Cast Time: 1

Range: 60 ft

Duration: Instantaneous

Save: Negates

AOE: One creature

Components: V

 

General

This spell transforms flesh to stone. 

The reverse of this spell is Stone to Flesh.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

A saving throw is permitted, and a system shock roll must be successful or the transformation into stone doesn't maintain a suspended state of life.
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • Target the caster and click the "Petrified - Permanent (T)" action

actionGroups.name: Wand of Wonder: (01-05) Slow
actionGroups.description:
[Foundry Note: as multiple functions can incur charges against the wand's overall pool, charges are tracked on the Attributes tab with each action set to "powered item".  After the wand is placed into an actor's gear list, this will require the wand to be set as the "inventory item" within these wand actions' castings that the charges are drawn from. 

Now for WoW specific notes...

  1. Not every wand function has an associated/automated effect and instead are cosmetic or DM fiat (example - target turns blue, etc.)
  2. In some cases information missing from the wand description is supplied from the associated spell as per the wand standard of a 6th level caster
  3. Some wand effects are from spells that don't have a range but the wand description implies a range when produced by the wand...without providing one (example - ESP, Vanish). In these cases an editorial decision to suggest 60 ft was made.
  4. In other cases the wand description implies if a chosen target is out of range for that effect, nothing happens (example - Enlarge/Reduce)
  5. In yet other cases the wand implies that the effect happens at a set distance regardless of who was targeted and how far away they were (example - leaf growth, Petrification)
  6. Lastly, some effects imply they happen at the end of the range whether or not the desired target is within the range (example - fireball, lightning bolt)
  7. Just use your best judgement and let it roll - it's a chaos item anyway

- Ed.]

 

Allowed Classes

Any

 

Details

[Foundry Note: many spell descriptions are lengthy; the user is directed to the wand action(s) for most spell descriptions. - Ed.]

[Foundry Note: The spell dmg in Foundry approximates the instruction to "make 1s into 2s" by changing the damage to 5d6+6 - Ed.] 

A wand of wonder is a strange and unpredictable device that randomly generates any number of weird effects each time it is used. Each use costs 1 charge.

In some cases a saving throw is appropriate. The effects should be considered typical of those possible, but the GM may adjust these or create new effects depending on the situation. Typical powers of the wand include the following:

 

@UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.rolltables.RollTable.hOsKWRNXo7QCbWlQ]{Wands - Wand of Wonder Result}

 

d% Wondrous Effect
01-05 Slow creature pointed at for 1 turn. [Range 150 ft]
06-10 Faerie Fire surrounds the target. [Range 80 ft]
11-15 Deludes wielder for 1 round into believing the rod functions as indicated by a second die roll (no save).
16-20 Gust of Wind, but at twice the power.
21-25 Wielder learns target's surface thoughts (as with ESP) for [[/roll 1d4]] rounds. [No range given when cast from WOW; suggest 60 ft]
26-30 Stinking Cloud at 30 ft range. [AOE 20 ft radius spherical cloud]
31-33 Heavy rain falls for 1 round in 60 ft radius centred on wand wielder.
34-36 Summon an animal - a rhino (01-25), elephant (26-50), or mouse (51-00).
37-46 Lightning Bolt (70-ft long, 5-ft wide), [[/roll 6d6]] damage. [Range: 100 ft]
47-49 Stream of 600 large butterflies pours forth and flutters around for 2 rounds, blinding everyone (including wielder).
50-53 Enlarge victim if within 60 ft of wand.
54-58 Darkness, 30 ft diameter hemisphere, centred 30-ft away from wand.
59-62 Grass grows in 160 ft square area before the wand, or grass existing there grows to ten times normal size.
63-65 Vanish any nonliving object of up to 1,000 lb mass and up to 30 ft cubed in size. [Range: 60 ft]
66-69 Reduce wielder to 1/12 height.
70-79 Fireball, [[/roll 6d6]] damage, as wand.
80-84 Invisibility covers wand wielder.
85-87 Leaves grow from target if within 60 ft of wand.
88-90 10-40 gems, value 1 gp each, shoot forth in a 30 ft long stream. Each gem deals 1 point of damage to any creature in its path: roll [[/roll 5d4]] for the number of hits.
91-95 Shimmering colours dance and play over a 40 ft×30 ft area in front of wand. Creatures therein are blinded for [[/roll 1d6]] rounds.
96-97 Wielder (50% chance) or target (50% chance) turns permanently blue, green, or purple.
98-00 Flesh to Stone (or Stone to Flesh if target is stone already) if target is within 60 ft.

actions.name: (01-05) Slow - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • (Optional) Use the  castshape action to visualize the area of effect (you can delete AOE templates if the Templates menu is active)
  • Target the chosen actor and click the  movement action corresponding to the actor's current movement rate

47-49 Stream of 600 large butterflies pours forth and flutters around for 2 rounds, blinding everyone (including wielder).
50-53 Enlarge victim if within 60 ft of wand.
54-58 Darkness, 30 ft diameter hemisphere, centred 30-ft away from wand.
59-62 Grass grows in 160 ft square area before the wand, or grass existing there grows to ten times normal size.
63-65 Vanish any nonliving object of up to 1,000 lb mass and up to 30 ft cubed in size. [Range: 60 ft]
66-69 Reduce wielder to 1/12 height.
70-79 Fireball, [[/roll 6d6]] damage, as wand.
80-84 Invisibility covers wand wielder.
85-87 Leaves grow from target if within 60 ft of wand.
88-90 10-40 gems, value 1 gp each, shoot forth in a 30 ft long stream. Each gem deals 1 point of damage to any creature in its path: roll [[/roll 5d4]] for the number of hits.
91-95 Shimmering colours dance and play over a 40 ft×30 ft area in front of wand. Creatures therein are blinded for [[/roll 1d6]] rounds.
96-97 Wielder (50% chance) or target (50% chance) turns permanently blue, green, or purple.
98-00 Flesh to Stone (or Stone to Flesh if target is stone already) if target is within 60 ft.

actionGroups.name: Wand of Wonder: (26-30) Stinking Cloud
actionGroups.description:
[Foundry Note: as multiple functions can incur charges against the wand's overall pool, charges are tracked on the Attributes tab with each action set to "powered item".  After the wand is placed into an actor's gear list, this will require the wand to be set as the "inventory item" within these wand actions' castings that the charges are drawn from. 

Now for WoW specific notes...

  1. Not every wand function has an associated/automated effect and instead are cosmetic or DM fiat (example - target turns blue, etc.)
  2. In some cases information missing from the wand description is supplied from the associated spell as per the wand standard of a 6th level caster
  3. Some wand effects are from spells that don't have a range but the wand description implies a range when produced by the wand...without providing one (example - ESP, Vanish). In these cases an editorial decision to suggest 60 ft was made.
  4. In other cases the wand description implies if a chosen target is out of range for that effect, nothing happens (example - Enlarge/Reduce)
  5. In yet other cases the wand implies that the effect happens at a set distance regardless of who was targeted and how far away they were (example - leaf growth, Petrification)
  6. Lastly, some effects imply they happen at the end of the range whether or not the desired target is within the range (example - fireball, lightning bolt)
  7. Just use your best judgement and let it roll - it's a chaos item anyway

- Ed.]

 

Allowed Classes

Any

actions.name: (26-30) Stinking Cloud - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • The player/GM can choose to use either the spell NPC or the castshape with the spell

 

Cast Shape

  • Use the  castshape action to visualize the area of effect (you can delete AOE templates if the Templates menu is active)
  • Target the caster and click the  "Stinking Cloud - Duration (C)" action

 

Spell NPC

  • When summoned, add @UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.actor.Actor.qYHHBonZhUcKYdxv]{Green Vapor} to the scene
  • toggle the Green Vapor token's visibility to "off"  and add it to the combat tracker - this is necessary for the automatic token death to work
  • Apply the "Fog Cloud - Duration Autokill" effect to the Green Vapor token on the map

 

Combat Effects

  • Target all actors in the cloud AOE then cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge and trigger saving throws (this may already have been done)
  • For actors that fail their save, click the "Stunned 2-5 rds - Duration (T)" action
  • For actors that make their save, click the "Stunned 1 rd - Duration (T)" action 
    • actors making their save can take no action other than leaving the cloud or face further saving throws

91-95 Shimmering colours dance and play over a 40 ft×30 ft area in front of wand. Creatures therein are blinded for [[/roll 1d6]] rounds.
96-97 Wielder (50% chance) or target (50% chance) turns permanently blue, green, or purple.
98-00 Flesh to Stone (or Stone to Flesh if target is stone already) if target is within 60 ft.

actions.name: (54-58) Darkness (AOE, 15 ft Rad) - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions (AOE Cast)

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • Target the actor who'll carry the Darkness 
    • Note that unlike clerical/monster Darkness, infravision does not penetrate any arcane Darkness so penalties apply to those having sight who carry it or are within it
  • Click the  "Carried Darkness - Duration (T)" action to apply it to the target actor

 

IF USING THE SPELL AS A FREE-STANDING SPHERE OF DARKNESS (ALTERNATE INSTRUCTIONS)

 

  • When summoned, add @UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.actor.Actor.yggi12L4PY7tYWC1]{Darkness 15 ft rad (Ball), Fixed AOE} to the scene
  • toggle the Darkness (AOE, 15 ft Rad) token's visibility to "off" 
  • Add it to the combat tracker - this is necessary for the automatic token death to work
  • Apply the  "Darkness-as-AOE - Duration Autokill" action to the Darkness (AOE, 15 ft Rad) token on the map

actionGroups.name: Wand of Wonder: (54-58) Darkness (Attack, 15 ft rad)
actionGroups.description:
[Foundry Note: as multiple functions can incur charges against the wand's overall pool, charges are tracked on the Attributes tab with each action set to "powered item".  After the wand is placed into an actor's gear list, this will require the wand to be set as the "inventory item" within these wand actions' castings that the charges are drawn from. 

Now for WoW specific notes...

  1. Not every wand function has an associated/automated effect and instead are cosmetic or DM fiat (example - target turns blue, etc.)
  2. In some cases information missing from the wand description is supplied from the associated spell as per the wand standard of a 6th level caster
  3. Some wand effects are from spells that don't have a range but the wand description implies a range when produced by the wand...without providing one (example - ESP, Vanish). In these cases an editorial decision to suggest 60 ft was made.
  4. In other cases the wand description implies if a chosen target is out of range for that effect, nothing happens (example - Enlarge/Reduce)
  5. In yet other cases the wand implies that the effect happens at a set distance regardless of who was targeted and how far away they were (example - leaf growth, Petrification)
  6. Lastly, some effects imply they happen at the end of the range whether or not the desired target is within the range (example - fireball, lightning bolt)
  7. Just use your best judgement and let it roll - it's a chaos item anyway

- Ed.]

 

Allowed Classes

Any

 

Details

[Foundry Note: many spell descriptions are lengthy; the user is directed to the wand action(s) for most spell descriptions. - Ed.]

[Foundry Note: The spell dmg in Foundry approximates the instruction to "make 1s into 2s" by changing the damage to 5d6+6 - Ed.] 

A wand of wonder is a strange and unpredictable device that randomly generates any number of weird effects each time it is used. Each use costs 1 charge.

In some cases a saving throw is appropriate. The effects should be considered typical of those possible, but the GM may adjust these or create new effects depending on the situation. Typical powers of the wand include the following:

 

@UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.rolltables.RollTable.hOsKWRNXo7QCbWlQ]{Wands - Wand of Wonder Result}

 

d% Wondrous Effect
01-05 Slow creature pointed at for 1 turn. [Range 150 ft]
06-10 Faerie Fire surrounds the target. [Range 80 ft]
11-15 Deludes wielder for 1 round into believing the rod functions as indicated by a second die roll (no save).
16-20 Gust of Wind, but at twice the power.
21-25 Wielder learns target's surface thoughts (as with ESP) for [[/roll 1d4]] rounds. [No range given when cast from WOW; suggest 60 ft]
26-30 Stinking Cloud at 30 ft range. [AOE 20 ft radius spherical cloud]
31-33 Heavy rain falls for 1 round in 60 ft radius centred on wand wielder.
34-36 Summon an animal - a rhino (01-25), elephant (26-50), or mouse (51-00).
37-46 Lightning Bolt (70-ft long, 5-ft wide), [[/roll 6d6]] damage. [Range: 100 ft]
47-49 Stream of 600 large butterflies pours forth and flutters around for 2 rounds, blinding everyone (including wielder).
50-53 Enlarge victim if within 60 ft of wand.
54-58 Darkness, 30 ft diameter hemisphere, centred 30-ft away from wand.
59-62 Grass grows in 160 ft square area before the wand, or grass existing there grows to ten times normal size.
63-65 Vanish any nonliving object of up to 1,000 lb mass and up to 30 ft cubed in size. [Range: 60 ft]
66-69 Reduce wielder to 1/12 height.
70-79 Fireball, [[/roll 6d6]] damage, as wand.
80-84 Invisibility covers wand wielder.
85-87 Leaves grow from target if within 60 ft of wand.
88-90 10-40 gems, value 1 gp each, shoot forth in a 30 ft long stream. Each gem deals 1 point of damage to any creature in its path: roll [[/roll 5d4]] for the number of hits.
91-95 Shimmering colours dance and play over a 40 ft×30 ft area in front of wand. Creatures therein are blinded for [[/roll 1d6]] rounds.
96-97 Wielder (50% chance) or target (50% chance) turns permanently blue, green, or purple.
98-00 Flesh to Stone (or Stone to Flesh if target is stone already) if target is within 60 ft.

actions.name: (54-58) Darkness (Attack, 15 ft rad) - Wand
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Ask your GM which of the two blindess versions they're using in their campaign (see description for differences)
  • Target the (presumably) enemy actor the caster intends to center the spell effect upon
  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (these may already have been done).
  • If the target actor makes their save, the darkness still occurs - it's just not centered upon them; drop a @UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.actor.Actor.yggi12L4PY7tYWC1]{Darkness 15 ft rad (Ball), Fixed AOE} spell actor in their area (which they may move away from)
  • If the target actor fails their save click either the  "Blinded - Duration (T)" action or the "STATUS Blind - Duration (T)" action to apply it to the targeted actor (this moves with the actor for the duration)
    • These effects have an aura which will automatically penalize any actor entering the darkness radius with no further effort required

  • Target everyone in the AOE then cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done) and trigger a saving throw
  • If the save fails, click on the Blindness action

actionGroups.name: Wand of Wonder: (98-00) Flesh to Stone
actionGroups.description:
[Foundry Note: as multiple functions can incur charges against the wand's overall pool, charges are tracked on the Attributes tab with each action set to "powered item".  After the wand is placed into an actor's gear list, this will require the wand to be set as the "inventory item" within these wand actions' castings that the charges are drawn from. 

Now for WoW specific notes...

  1. Not every wand function has an associated/automated effect and instead are cosmetic or DM fiat (example - target turns blue, etc.)
  2. In some cases information missing from the wand description is supplied from the associated spell as per the wand standard of a 6th level caster
  3. Some wand effects are from spells that don't have a range but the wand description implies a range when produced by the wand...without providing one (example - ESP, Vanish). In these cases an editorial decision to suggest 60 ft was made.
  4. In other cases the wand description implies if a chosen target is out of range for that effect, nothing happens (example - Enlarge/Reduce)
  5. In yet other cases the wand implies that the effect happens at a set distance regardless of who was targeted and how far away they were (example - leaf growth, Petrification)
  6. Lastly, some effects imply they happen at the end of the range whether or not the desired target is within the range (example - fireball, lightning bolt)
  7. Just use your best judgement and let it roll - it's a chaos item anyway

- Ed.]

 

Allowed Classes

Any

 

Details

[Foundry Note: many spell descriptions are lengthy; the user is directed to the wand action(s) for most spell descriptions. - Ed.]

[Foundry Note: The spell dmg in Foundry approximates the instruction to "make 1s into 2s" by changing the damage to 5d6+6 - Ed.] 

A wand of wonder is a strange and unpredictable device that randomly generates any number of weird effects each time it is used. Each use costs 1 charge.

In some cases a saving throw is appropriate. The effects should be considered typical of those possible, but the GM may adjust these or create new effects depending on the situation. Typical powers of the wand include the following:

 

@UUID[Compendium.osric-compendium.rolltables.RollTable.hOsKWRNXo7QCbWlQ]{Wands - Wand of Wonder Result}

 

d% Wondrous Effect
01-05 Slow creature pointed at for 1 turn. [Range 150 ft]
06-10 Faerie Fire surrounds the target. [Range 80 ft]
11-15 Deludes wielder for 1 round into believing the rod functions as indicated by a second die roll (no save).
16-20 Gust of Wind, but at twice the power.
21-25 Wielder learns target's surface thoughts (as with ESP) for [[/roll 1d4]] rounds. [No range given when cast from WOW; suggest 60 ft]
26-30 Stinking Cloud at 30 ft range. [AOE 20 ft radius spherical cloud]
31-33 Heavy rain falls for 1 round in 60 ft radius centred on wand wielder.
34-36 Summon an animal - a rhino (01-25), elephant (26-50), or mouse (51-00).
37-46 Lightning Bolt (70-ft long, 5-ft wide), [[/roll 6d6]] damage. [Range: 100 ft]
47-49 Stream of 600 large butterflies pours forth and flutters around for 2 rounds, blinding everyone (including wielder).
50-53 Enlarge victim if within 60 ft of wand.
54-58 Darkness, 30 ft diameter hemisphere, centred 30-ft away from wand.
59-62 Grass grows in 160 ft square area before the wand, or grass existing there grows to ten times normal size.
63-65 Vanish any nonliving object of up to 1,000 lb mass and up to 30 ft cubed in size. [Range: 60 ft]
66-69 Reduce wielder to 1/12 height.
70-79 Fireball, [[/roll 6d6]] damage, as wand.
80-84 Invisibility covers wand wielder.
85-87 Leaves grow from target if within 60 ft of wand.
88-90 10-40 gems, value 1 gp each, shoot forth in a 30 ft long stream. Each gem deals 1 point of damage to any creature in its path: roll [[/roll 5d4]] for the number of hits.
91-95 Shimmering colours dance and play over a 40 ft×30 ft area in front of wand. Creatures therein are blinded for [[/roll 1d6]] rounds.
96-97 Wielder (50% chance) or target (50% chance) turns permanently blue, green, or purple.
98-00 Flesh to Stone (or Stone to Flesh if target is stone already) if target is within 60 ft.

Auto-created for Flaming Blade, Long

[Foundry Note: the GM will need to track halved number of attacks for slowed creatures manually, but four movement rate effects are provided which halve the common base move rates of 120, 90, 60, and 30, for the GM to selectively apply if applicable. - Ed.]

 

General

This spell acts upon its targets to slow down their movements.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

The spell may be cast upon up to 1 creature/caster level, but all must be within the spell's area of effect at the time of casting.

Haste and Slow automatically cancel each other without any shocks to the systems of those affected.

 

Combat Effects

Any creature affected by a Slow spell will find that it can only move at half normal speed and attack at half its normal rate.

If more than one Slow spell is cast upon the same subject, the effects of the two spells will be cumulative.

nwp.name: Ancient History
nwp.description: The character has learned the legends, lore, and history of some ancient time and place. The knowledge must be specific, just as a historian would specialize today in the English Middle Ages, the Italian Renaissance, or the Roman Republic before Caesar.

nwp.name: Reading/Writing
nwp.description: The character can read and write a modern language he can speak, provided there is someone available to teach the character (another player character, an NPC hireling, or an NPC hired for the purpose).

nwp.name: Religion
nwp.description: Characters with religion proficiency know the common beliefs and cults of their homeland and the major faiths of neighboring regions. Ordinary information (type of religious symbol used, basic attitude of the faith, etc.) of any religion is automatically known by the character.

nwp.name: Spellcraft
nwp.description: Although this proficiency does not grant the character any spellcasting powers, it does give him familiarity with the different forms and rites of spellcasting. If he observes and overhears someone who is casting a spell, or if he examines the material components used, he can attempt to identify the spell being cast.

nwp.name: Riding, Land-Based
nwp.description: Those skilled in land riding are proficient in the art of riding and handling horses or other types of ground mounts. When the proficiency slot is filled, the character must declare which type of mount he is proficient in.

nwp.name: Etiquette
nwp.description: This proficiency gives the character a basic understanding of the proper forms of behavior and address required in many different situations, especially those involving nobility and persons of rank. Thus, the character knows the correct title to use when addressing a duke, the proper steps of ceremony to greet visiting diplomats, gestures to avoid in the presence of dwarves, etc.

nwp.name: Heraldry
nwp.description: The knowledge of heraldry enables the character to identify the different crests and symbols that denote different persons and groups. Heraldry comes in many forms and is used for many different purposes. It can be used to identify noblemen, families, guilds, sects, legions, political factions, and castes.

nwp.name: Artistic Ability
nwp.description: Player characters with artistic ability are naturally accomplished in various forms of the arts. They have an inherent understanding of color, form, space, flow, tone, pitch, and rhythm.
